online.common
Class internationalStrings

java.lang.Object
  online.common.internationalStrings

public abstract class internationalStrings
extends java.lang.Object

this class is the repository for translation strings and language support in the java applet.

all the user interface strings for each language are collected into one instance of the class, which is loaded at runtime. The class support a limited substitution of variables into otherwise constant strings, and a few other tricks for specific languages.

There is also a very simple line-splitter to break regular strings into short lines with a very limited hyphenation capability.

the key strings are usuallyjust the English strings used in the programs, so the code is readable.

In the key string, elements such as #1 #2 are variables. The translation strings should have the same variables, but not necessarily in the same other.

Author:
ddyer

split

public java.lang.String split(java.lang.String sub)
this double substitution through realsplit is a trick to virtualize the split method. All the instances of various subclasses of internationalStrings are cast to plain internationalStrings, so they all come here, not to the split method in the subclass. This dispatch to realSplit gets us to the real subclassed method

Parameters:
sub -
Returns:
a substitute string

getS

public java.lang.String getS(java.lang.String args)
this is a limited capability to translate where both the string and the substutution arguments are part of the key string. This is used in "translatable chat" messages. Call s.getS("foo fred dave") to be equivalent to s.get("foo","fred","dave") where the translation of foo is put("foo","the message for #1 from #2");

Parameters:
args -
Returns:
a substitute string with the argument inserted

get

public java.lang.String get(java.lang.String sub,
                            java.lang.String... args)
Parameters:
sub -
args - optional args are printed using "format"
Returns:
get a translated string, optionally with with substituted parameter
